title: 168: Philosophy and Pop Culture
itunes:author: Philosophy Talk Starters
itunes:summary:
More at www.philosophytalk.org/shows/philosophy-and-pop-culture.

From Star Trek and the Grateful Dead to South Park and Stephen Colbert, philosophical questions are everywhere in popular culture: Is time travel possible? Can a person survive being disintegrated and reassembled? Does humor enable the expression of deep truths, political or otherwise? John and Ken look at the Big Questions in pop culture with Richard Hanley from the University of Delaware, author of "South Park and Philosophy."
itunes:subtitle: More at www.philosophytalk.org/shows/philosophy-aâ€¦
description:
More at www.philosophytalk.org/shows/philosophy-and-pop-culture.

From Star Trek and the Grateful Dead to South Park and Stephen Colbert, philosophical questions are everywhere in popular culture: Is time travel possible? Can a person survive being disintegrated and reassembled? Does humor enable the expression of deep truths, political or otherwise? John and Ken look at the Big Questions in pop culture with Richard Hanley from the University of Delaware, author of "South Park and Philosophy."
